This is obviously a user error. Sorry, but I can't debug your XML files for you ...
Note that you *must* use the Xerces bins bundled with Tomcat. Please don't
replace them unless you know what you're doing.
creator: remm@apache.org
ronkarim@yahoo.com
text:
These are "Brand New INstallations" with NO files "touched" by the user.
We even re-installed Windows 2000 once.
I can get a Brand New Tomcat, either LE or the FULL, of the 4.1.8 version we 
get the same error
messages. 
Please note, these errors happen "right-out-ofthe-box" without us touching
any of the TOMCAT files.
We need your help to bring up tomcat on this NEW WIndows Machine.
We haven't even modified the server.xml file.

Can you at least tell us what XML file is causing the problem ?

creator: ronkarim@yahoo.com
text:
The Problem only happens with Sun's Java SDK version JDK1.4.1_01,
When I install J2sdk1.4.0_03, Tomcat comes up with no problems...
I think this issue should be documented. On the Linux box, it was up 
for 3 days, and then it startup to happen again, the JDK(Hotspot) reported
an error and tomcat came down.
Let me know if it's relevant to send you the Hotspot error file here.
Thanks
Ron Karim

creator: ronkarim@yahoo.com
text:
The problem was a corrupted servlet.jar or an old servlet.jar that was placed 
in the Java/JRE/ext directory
